songInfo.album: from The Complete Plantation Recordings (Chess/MCA CHD-9344) ,

lyrics.l: Well I am a ramblin' kid, I been ramblin' all of my days
Yes, I am a ramblin' kid, an' I been ramblin' all of my days

Well you know my baby, she want me to stop ramblin', so she says
she'll change her ways
Well now, ain't no use in you ramblin', when your baby don't want you ramblin' 'round
Yeah, an ain't no use in you ramblin', when your baby don't want you ramblin' around

Well now you know if you keep on ramblin', she be done drove on outta
this town
No, I ain't gonna ramble, babe, an I ain't gonna ramble no more
Yes, I ain't gonna ramble, tried it an I ain't gonna ramble no more

Well you know if I keep on a-ramblin', I be driftin' from door to
door
Blow that thing boy!
Play a long time!
I feel lowdown this mornin'
Lord have mercy!
(What was she gonna do?)
Girl, I'm leavin', I'm leavin' babe
No I ain't gonna ramble no more
(Later I feel lowdown)
Sonny!
Girl now I'm leavin', I'm leavin' babe, now I ain't gonna ramble no more
Lord, I'm leavin' I'm leavin' (Lord have mercy), child, I ain't gonna ramble no more

Well you know I have been ramblin' 'round here, lose a woman
ev'rywhere I go
lyrics.note: Note: track no. 8. This song is an Alan Lomax field recording of the Son Sims Four. Before moving on to Chicago, Muddy Waters was a member of this Mississippi Delta group.
